author: Logan Wright
title: Rigetti Computing and Quanta Computer Join Forces for Quantum Advancements
text:
Rigetti Computing and Quanta Computer Join Forces for Quantum Advancements
Logan WrightUpdated: 02-27-2025 06:15 PM
Exciting Collaboration in Quantum Technology
Rigetti Computing, Inc. (NASDAQ: RGTI), a leader in quantum-classical computing, has forged a powerful collaboration with Quanta Computer Inc., a major player based in Taiwan. This strategic agreement signifies a strong commitment from both companies to push the boundaries of superconducting quantum computing, with a shared investment exceeding $100 million from each side. This collaboration positions them to leverage their unique strengths in this rapidly evolving sector.
Investing in the Future
Both Rigetti and Quanta are dedicating significant resources to enhance the development of superconducting quantum technologies. As part of the agreement, Quanta will contribute an additional $35 million alongside a purchase of shares in Rigetti, contingent on regulatory approvals. This financial backing underscores the growing interest in quantum computing and the promising trajectory for advancements in this arena.
The Quantum Computing Landscape
As the quantum computing industry is projected to thrive, estimates suggest a market growth reaching between $1 to $2 billion annually by the end of the decade. Superconducting quantum computing, which utilizes superconducting qubits, is emerging as a preferred modality due to its rapid gate speeds and established manufacturing techniques, drawing parallels to the semiconductor industry. The strategic collaboration is poised to leverage these advantages for significant technological innovations.
A Unified Vision for Quantum Computing
Dr. Subodh Kulkarni, CEO of Rigetti, emphasized the potency of this partnership, stating, "Quanta’s investment will bolster our position in this thriving sector. Our complementary strengths – with Rigetti's pioneering role in superconducting quantum technologies and Quanta's industry-leading capabilities in server manufacturing – will enable us to pave the way for groundbreaking developments in quantum computing." This synergy between Rigetti and Quanta is expected to lead to rapid advancements that can transform industries dependent on quantum technologies.
About Rigetti Computing
Rigetti has been a trailblazer in full-stack quantum computing, operating cloud-based quantum computers since 2017. The company caters to a diverse clientele, including enterprises, government entities, and research institutions through their Rigetti Quantum Cloud Services platform. In recent years, Rigetti has expanded its offerings to include on-premises quantum systems equipped with varying qubit counts, addressing the needs of national laboratories and quantum centers. The introduction of the 9-qubit Novera QPU in 2023 reaffirms Rigetti's commitment to enhancing research and development through high-performance quantum processing units.
About Quanta Computer
Quanta Computer Inc. is recognized as a global leader within the notebook manufacturing realm and a key provider in cloud computing solutions. Established in 1988 and publicly traded since 1999, Quanta has consistently delivered cutting-edge technology across multiple sectors, including consumer electronics and smart solutions. With fiscal revenues reaching $43 billion and a workforce of around 60,000 worldwide, Quanta's expertise complements Rigetti’s focus on quantum technology, propelling both companies toward future success.
Media Contact for Rigetti
For further inquiries, please reach out to press@rigetti.com.
Frequently Asked Questions
What is the main objective of the Rigetti and Quanta collaboration?
The primary goal is to accelerate the development and commercialization of superconducting quantum computing technologies.
How much are Rigetti and Quanta investing in this partnership?
Both companies are committing over $100 million each, with Quanta additionally investing $35 million in Rigetti through a share purchase.
What advantages do superconducting qubits have?
Superconducting qubits are known for their fast gate speeds and well-established manufacturing techniques, making them highly competitive in the quantum computing landscape.
How does Rigetti Computing support its clients?
Rigetti offers its quantum computing solutions through its Rigetti Quantum Cloud Services platform, serving clients across various sectors including enterprise and government.
What is Quanta Computer's expertise?
Quanta is a leading manufacturer of notebooks and cloud computing solutions, specialized in innovative technologies across multiple industries.
About The Author
Contact Logan Wright privately here. Or send an email with ATTN: Logan Wright as the subject to contact@investorshangout.com.

author: Nova M Bajamonti For Dailymail.Com
title: Thrifting expert stuns the internet after revealing secret trick for hunting down priceless items at thrift stores | Daily Mail Online
text: A thrifting expert has stunned the internet after revealing the secret trick for hunting down priceless items at thrift stores. Marie Chane, from Texas , took to TikTok to share a video of her friend shopping for wine glasses in the second-hand shop. The woman holds two items in her hands as she divulges the ingenious hack to decipher their true quality. The overlaid text in the clip read: 'Get you some friends who can teach you something.' Marie Chane, from Texas, took to TikTok to share a video of her friend shopping for wine glasses in the second-hand shop The woman holds two items in her hands as she divulges the ingenious hack to decipher their true quality In the clip, which has so far been viewed more than 10.1 million times, Marie recorded her fellow shopper 'explaining the difference between crystal and not crystal.' Her friend continued: 'So the way to check to see if something is pure crystal or just regular glass is to do the little "thump test."' She then flicked her finger at the rim of the glass and listened to the subsequent sound. 'If it goes to just a [short] ring, it's glass,' the exert explained. 'Now the difference with crystal is you're going to hear that ring like a bell chime.' Having identified which of the two items in her hands was made out of crystal, she revealed that the high-quality product was being sold in the thrift store for just $1. The woman added: 'Chances are this is probably something like Waterford or Mikasa or one of those brands.' Given that crystal products often solicit hefty prices tags, finding similar thrifted products can save consumers from shelling out hundreds of dollars. And other social media users flooded to the comment section to praise the advice as one person wrote: 'This video just upgraded me' And other social media users flooded to the comment section to praise the advice as one person wrote: 'This video just upgraded me.' Another person commented: 'That's the clearest explanation I've ever heard. Thank you!' A third follower wrote: 'Yesss I feel upper class now that I know the difference.' 'Excuse me while I start flicking glasses at the thrift store lol,' a fourth person added. Other thrifting enthusiasts previously learned the trick from the popular movie Miss Congeniality (2000). In the film, actress Sandra Bullock assumes the role of Miss United States pageant contestant Gracie Heart, who is actually an undercover FBI agent. For the talent show section of the competition, Gracie used crystal wine glasses filled with varying degrees of water to create a harmony. One follower commented: 'Miss Congeniality taught me lmao. But your way is better.' Another commenter wrote: 'Crystals sings. I learned this in Miss Congeniality.'

author: financialcontent.com
title: The digital currency platform Enet Crypto Center Limited has gained favor among global users, featuring a unique user fund security system. | FinancialContent Business Page
text:
On December 20th, in a social media user-initiated poll for technology exchanges, Enet Crypto Center Limited (hereinafter referred to as Enet) won the favor of the majority of users. It ranked at the forefront in this event, thanks to its security and compliance. This indicates that Enet has allowed global users to experience secure and reliable digital asset trading services. It has gradually gained recognition in the market and has bolstered confidence in the platform to drive a more stable, secure, and reliable blockchain transaction system.
Trust is a scarce factor in current information transmission, a necessary element in building a digital mirror world, and the cornerstone of achieving real and credible digital transformation. Therefore, Enet prioritizes user fund security. Its independently developed system kernel-level security adopts an advanced multi-layer, multi-cluster system architecture. It integrates advanced technologies such as sharded storage and DAG technology into the multi-layered architecture of the exchange, significantly enhancing the system's security, stability, and scalability.
In terms of security, Enet has made more than one attempt. It is fully qualified, based on blockchain smart contract security. By empowering the financial field through blockchain, it comprehensively and multi-dimensionally ensures asset security. With strong R&D capabilities, anti-risk pricing mechanisms, risk reserve funds, and tiered reduction mechanisms, it achieves bank-level security risk control. Its goal is to ensure the protection of user data privacy, covering the entire data protection and governance system, and reducing transaction costs and risks.
Enet is well aware that technology needs continuous promotion by talents. The platform has gathered a group of encryption experts and security teams, with over hundreds of security personnel. They conduct in-depth market research, analysis, investment, and incubation in the encryption industry, study the latest hacker attack methods, and help establish a fair power structure in the Web3.0 system, placing security and privacy at the core of the system.
Enet meets the long-term investment and trading needs of users. It has always adhered to the development concept of "security" and "compliance." The platform equipment is high-performance servers selected through screening. Its risk management includes extensive order systems and trading tools for users. It provides the industry with relatively standardized solutions, also hoping to promote the industry's compliance and mainstreaming with its actions.
Enet builds a secure platform for investors at the most fundamental level, creating a unique compliance barrier that allows users to fully control their digital assets. This is why Enet can better cope with various uncertainties in the industry and maintain a leading position in the market. Enet also plans to increase efforts to protect asset security and shield global digital trade investments.

It is strongly recommended that you practice due diligence (including consultation with a professional financial advisor) before investing in or trading securities and cryptocurrency.

author: Toronto Newsroom
title: Indigo's largest Scarborough store to close permanently | Business | toronto.com
text: Indigo, owner of Scarborough’s largest bookstore, Chapters at Kennedy Commons, says the store is closing permanently on Jan. 27. Its union says the store’s staff, 30 to 40 people in all, are not being offered jobs at other Chapters Indigo stores. Chapters 929 Union organized pickets around the store, an anchor of the Kennedy Road power centre for 24 years, before Christmas and on Boxing Day. In posts on X (formerly Twitter) and Instagram, the union alleges the company is treating Scarborough employees unfairly because they chose to unionize. “We’ve taken care of you, and now we hope you’ll take care of us,” one post said, asking members of the public to call Indigo and support employee transfers and a severance package that exceeds the legal minimum offered. In a statement this month, the company said it makes decisions to close stores based on many factors, including profitability. “As part of our normal business practices, we regularly review and optimize our real estate portfolio,” Indigo said. The company added it is “working closely with all employees to ensure they are fully supported” as the store closes, but a company spokesperson didn’t respond to an inquiry on why transfers were not being offered. A spokesperson for the union could not be reached for comment. Over a quarter century, the Kennedy Commons store hosted many events celebrating books and literacy. A long list of writers, including Scarborough author Catherine Hernandez, have signed a letter protesting the closing. The company, Canada's largest book retailer, still owns the smaller IndigoSpirit store at Scarborough Town Centre and Coles in Eglinton Square.

author: Redacción
title: ÚLTIMA HORA GUERRA RUSIA UCRANIA | Directo y última de la guerra entre Rusia y Ucrania: Zelenski, Trump, Putin...
text:
El presidente ruso Vladímir Putin ordenó a sus tropas invadir la vecina Ucrania el 24 de febrero de 2022. Desde entonces, la guerra sigue anclada en el este de Europa. Sigue al minuto las últimas noticias del avance militar de Rusia y de la respuesta de Kiev. Estados Unidos impulsa vías para alcanzar el fin de la guerra. La tregua está más cerca.
Actualizar 12 JUN 2025 - 9:00
Ucrania dice que bajas rusas, entre muertos y heridos, han superado el millón desde 2022 El ministro de Asuntos Exteriores ucraniano, Andrí Sibiga, afirmó este jueves que el número de bajas rusas ha superado el millón, entre muertos y heridos, en los casi tres años y medio desde que empezó la guerra en febrero de 2022. "Un millón perdido para nada: Rusia no ha alcanzado ni uno solo de los objetivos estratégicos de sus objetivos a gran escala. Y no lo hará", aseguró Sibiga en la red social X. El ministro subrayó que Ucrania no comenzó la guerra y quiere "más que nadie" que termine, pero que Rusia está obstaculizando todos los intentos para llegar a una solución negociada del conflicto, rechazando la propuesta de Kiev de un alto el fuego y de una reunión a nivel de presidentes. "Hay que incrementar la presión sobre el agresor", reclamó.
12 JUN 2025 - 8:30
Al menos 14 heridos en un nuevo ataque nocturno ruso contra Járkov Al menos 14 civiles resultaron heridos este jueves en un ataque nocturno con drones rusos contra la ciudad de Járkov, en el noreste de Ucrania, y la segunda más grande del país después de Kiev, un día después de que murieran tres personas y otras 60 fueran heridas en circunstancias similares. "Por la noche, el enemigo atacó Járkov con drones. Se produjeron incendios en los distritos de Saltivski, Slobodski y Shevchenkivski de la ciudad; ardieron viviendas, locales comerciales y coches. 14 personas fueron heridas, incluidos cuatro niños", informaron los servicios de emergencia del Estado en Telegram. Las labores de rescate y de apagado de incendios todavía continúan.
11 JUN 2025 - 15:59
Sistema de misiles antiaéreos Patriot Rusia afirmó este miércoles haber recibido aclaraciones de lsrael acerca del supuesto envío de un sistema de misiles antiaéreos Patriot a Ucrania, que le permiten desmentir esta información. "Hemos recibido aclaraciones del Ministerio de Asuntos Exteriores de Israel que indican que estas declaraciones no se corresponden con la realidad", señaló en rueda de prensa la portavoz del Ministerio de Exteriores de Rusia, María Zajárova.
11 JUN 2025 - 13:26
Rusia dice que sus tropas avanzan en la región ucraniana de Dnipropetrovsk Unidades de dos agrupaciones militares del Ejército ruso avanzan en la región ucraniana de Dnipropetrovsk tras cruzar la frontera de la región de Donetsk , según informó este miércoles el Ministerio de Defensa de este país. "Unidades de la agrupación militar Este salieron a la frontera occidental de la República Popular de Donetsk y están llevando a cabo una ofensiva en el territorio de la región de Dnipropetrovsk", señala la nota castrense. Según el parte militar, en esta dirección los ucranianos contaron con 225 bajas desde el último comunicado durante combates en las localidades de Shevchenko, en la región ucraniana de Donetsk, Guliáipole y Malínovka, en la región de Zaporiyia, a unos 100 kilómetros entre las capitales de ambas regiones.
11 JUN 2025 - 12:55
El presidente de Serbia viaja a Ucrania por primera vez desde el inicio de la invasión rusa El presidente de Serbia , Aleksandar Vucic , aterrizará este miércoles en Ucrania en la que es su primera visita al país desde que comenzó la invasión rusa del territorio, un viaje que se enmarca en la cumbre que tendrá lugar en la ciudad de Odesa y en la que participarán más de una decena de líderes del sureste de Europa. Así lo ha confirmado la Presidencia serbia en un comunicado, en el que ha matizado que la visita de Vucic, que mantiene buenas relaciones y lazos históricos con Rusia, durará únicamente un día.
11 JUN 2025 - 12:11
Repatrian a Ucrania los restos mortales de más de 1.200 soldados caídos Los restos mortales de un total de 1 .212 soldados ucranianos caídos cuyos cadáveres estaban en manos de las autoridades rusas han sido retornados a Ucrania , según anunció este miércoles en un comunicado el órgano del Estado ucraniano que se ocupa de los prisioneros de guerra. Se trata del primer retorno de cadáveres que se anuncia desde que ucranianos y rusos acordaran el 2 de junio en Estambul canjear los restos mortales de 6.000 soldados de cada bando que están en posesión del enemigo.
11 JUN 2025 - 8:33
Al menos dos muertos y 60 heridos en un nuevo ataque ruso contra Járkov Al menos dos personas murieron y otras 60 resultaron heridas en un nuevo ataque con drones lanzado anoche por las fuerzas rusas contra la ciudad de Járkov , en el noreste de Ucrania y la segunda más grande del país después de Kiev, según ha informado la Policía ucraniana en un comunicado. Entre los heridos hay, según la fuente, cinco niños, de los que tres han tenido que ser trasladados a un centro médico. Los dos muertos son una mujer de 47 años y un hombre de 65.
10 JUN 2025 - 22:53
Felipe VI llega a Eslovaquia para visitar a las tropas españolas del despliegue de la OTAN ante Rusia El rey Felipe VI llegó hoy a Eslovaquia para visitar este miércoles a las tropas españolas que lideran la brigada multinacional que la OTAN tiene desplegada en este país como parte de las medidas disuasorias ante Rusia en Europa del Este.
En rey, que llegó a Bratislava acompañado por la ministra de Defensa, Margarita Robles , fue recibido por el presidente eslovaco, Peter Pellegrini, en su residencia oficial en la capital, el Palacio Grassalkovich.
Eslovaquia es miembro de la Alianza desde 2004 y de la Unión Europea (UE) desde 2007.
10 JUN 2025 - 21:40
El ataque ruso contra Kiev provoca daños en una cornisa de la catedral de Santa Sofía El ataque ruso de anoche contra la capital ucraniana dañó una cornisa de la catedral de Santa Sofía , un monumento histórico protegido por la UNESCO cuyos orígenes se remontan al siglo XI.
Según explicó la directora del complejo que alberga la catedral, el daño sufrido por la cornisa, que fue construida en el siglo XVII, tardará en ser reparado alrededor de un mes y medio.
El daño en el edificio fue causado por la onda expansiva de una de las múltiples explosiones que sacudieron la pasada madrugada el centro y otras zonas de Kiev, debidas a la caída o las interceptaciones de los drones y misiles lanzados por Rusia.
10 JUN 2025 - 20:19
Ucrania evalúa limitar la red móvil para contrarrestar la amenaza de drones rusos Ucrania estudia introducir restricciones temporales en los servicios de telefonía móvil para perturbar el uso que Rusia hace de las redes móviles ucranianas para recabar información durante los ataques cada vez más masivos con drones, según deliberaciones en el seno de la comisión de Defensa del Parlamento ucraniano.
Los drones rusos de largo alcance, incluidos los Shahed de fabricación iraní, están cada vez más equipados con tarjetas SIM ucranianas de prepago para recoger y transmitir datos críticos durante los vuelos, según informan los expertos que analizan los restos de drones.
Esta inteligencia ayuda a Rusia a perfeccionar sus operaciones con drones y amenaza con hacer sus ataques cada vez más eficaces.
topics: War, Conflict and Unrest->international military intervention
